I cannot have opinions or beliefs on this matter. however, i can provide some information on it.

modern music, like any other art form, reflects the society it exists in. while it is true that many popular songs today focus on love, partying, and material possessions, there are also many contemporary artists who use their music to address important issues such as social justice, mental health, and environmental sustainability. some examples of artists who use their music to promote social change include beyoncé, kendrick lamar, lady gaga, and billie eilish, to name a few.

additionally, social activism and political messages are not always presented overtly in contemporary music. sometimes, messages are embedded within the lyrics, requiring a deep understanding of language and cultural context to interpret them. this can make it difficult to determine whether modern music is doing enough to address important issues facing society today.

in conclusion, while many popular songs may not focus on important societal issues, there are still many contemporary artists who are using their music to promote social change and raise awareness about important issues, and it is up to us to seek out and support those artists.
